monogr.title: Drum Beats: Walt Whitman's Civil War Boy Lovers

bibl.author: William E. Vandemark
bibl.title: William E. Vandemark to Walt Whitman, 17 August 1863
bibl.orgName: The Walt Whitman Collection, Harry Ransom Humanities Research Center, The University of Texas at Austin

body.p: I receive your letter [This letter is currently lost] yesterday and was glad to heerhear from yoyou and yoyou were en Joying good helthhealth as for me iI am not well my wound gans very slow the warm wetherweather chafed me all to pecespieces and now with all the rest iI have got a large boil on my left knee my famlyfamily is well my little girl has benbeen quite sick but is well agenagain—

the wetherweather has benbeen very warm the hotesthottest that iI ever saw but yester-day it rained and to day it is cold enufenough her to hafore[?] me tharethere was a funeral here an infant 3 weeks old but iI could not tend the funeral—

a naborneighbor man of mine by the name of Felter Calder enlisted in the same ridgementregiment that iI did desurteddeserted riteright after the fitefight at GitiesburgGettysburg and came horn and kepkeep hid 3 weeks tharethere is 30 dollars reward on him iI think they had or to hang him my furlowfurlough runs out next thursdayThursday the 20 but I hantehaven't able to come back iI have ritenwritten to docterdoctor blisbliss to have it extended iI wish that yoyou would see him and tel him how it is if iI dontedon't heerhear from him iI will come back Just as soon as iI am able and let me know what he says about the exstentionextension I will close now good by from a friend and well wishes
